title: 105_hr120
content: The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" includes definitions. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends Section 101 of title 11, United States Code by making various changes to definitions within the code. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 makes adjustments to dollar amounts, extends time limits, imposes penalties for fraudulent bankruptcy petitions, revises eligibility criteria for trustees, and addresses the employment of professional persons in bankruptcy cases. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends sections 327 and 328 of title 11, United States Code, regarding the authority of trustees and limitations on compensation for professional services in bankruptcy cases. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends sections 327 and 328 of title 11, United States Code, regarding the authority of trustees and limitations on compensation for professional services in bankruptcy cases by updating the language to refer to "such professional person" instead of specifically mentioning "attorney or accountant". SEC. 6 amends compensation rules for professional persons in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 7 adjusts compensation for officers. SEC. 8 modifies special tax provisions. SEC. 9 addresses the effect of conversion. SEC. 10 concerns the automatic stay. SEC. 10 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions related to security interests and entities. SEC. 11 deals with executory contracts and unexpired leases. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in executory contracts or unexpired leases, as well as provisions related to defaults arising from nonmonetary obligations. Subsection (c) is also amended to remove paragraph (4). Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by removing certain paragraphs in subsections (d) and (f)(1) and inserting periods in their place. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. Amends the item relating to section 556 regarding contractual rights. SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) by inserting references before "paragraph (3)". SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed". SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amends Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, regarding liabilities and support. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Additionally, subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify that certain debts can be imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Amendments include changing references from "section 1915 (b) or (f)" to "subsection (b) or (f)(2) of section 1915" and correcting "a insured" to "an insured" in subsection (e). SEC. 17. Amendment to Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, US Code regarding discharge effects. SEC. 18. Amendment to Section 525(c) of title 11, US Code for protection against discriminatory treatment. SEC. 19. Amendment to Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, US Code for property of the estate. SEC. 20. Limitations on avoiding powers. SEC. 20. Limitations on avoiding powers. Section 546 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by redesignating the second subsection (g) as subsection (h). SEC. 21. Liability of transferee of avoided transfer. SEC. 21 amends Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code regarding the liability of transferee of avoided transfers. It clarifies the recoverability of transfers made for the benefit of a non-insider transferee. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 547(b) of title 11. SEC. 22 amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by changing the reference from "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23 modifies Section 726(b) by removing the reference to "1009,". SEC. 24 updates Section 901(a) by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25 addresses the appointment of an elected trustee. SEC. 25 amends Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code regarding the appointment of an elected trustee. If a trustee is elected at a creditors' meeting, the United States trustee must certify the election. Any trustee appointed under subsection (d) will be replaced by the elected trustee. In case of disputes, the court will resolve them. SEC. 26 to SEC. 30 amend various sections of title 11, United States Code related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. Amendments include changes in section numbers and references. SEC. 30 amends section 1322 of title 11, United States Code by changing subsection references. SEC. 31 modifies section 1328(a) regarding debt discharge. SEC. 32 addresses bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 32 amends Section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code, regarding bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33 modifies Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994. SEC. 34 pertains to knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code, regarding knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 35 of the Act states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
